comments.body: We shouldn't display this flag when the value is false. For example, typical inspector users should care less that `needsCompositing: false` as generally the inspector should only be querying Data after a frame has completed so it will always be false.

I'm a little confused why the code you wrote would be indicating that this flag is false. Hopefully you generated these updated goldens before tweaking your code otherwise there is a bug in FlagProperty which we should fix.

Yeah, I agree.  I was surprised to see that it printed the name instead of the "needs compositing" string. I assumed it had something to do with the treatment of the `hidden` log level. These are what got generated after I made my changes.
Ah ok. The output makes complete sense now.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +409,413 @@        '         │
'
        '         └─child: RenderPositionedBox#00000
'
        '           │ needsCompositing: false
'
        '           │ creator: Align ← Padding ← DecoratedBox ← DecoratedBox ←
'
        '           │   ConstrainedBox ← Padding ← Container ← Align ← [root]
'

comments.body: Feel free to instead remove the DiagnosticLevel.hidden from this toStringDeep call. That just makes the output of this test more confusing.

Actually, it looks like that test is there specifically testing the different levels of diagnostic output for `Container`.  There are tests for each of the levels, so if I change this, I would just get rid of it (since there's already a test for each of the others).  It doesn't make sense to get rid of it, so I'm just going to leave it as-is.
There should also be additional tests verifying that ShapeBorder.getClipPath and BoxBorder.getClipPath return the right thing.

uber nit: this looks a little weird in `widgets`, I guess it's so you can use `Colors`?  I have a vague hope that someday we could run tests based on what they import, and things like this will probably have to be rewritten. But it happens elsewhere, it's ok to leave for now.
